author: Omar Rashid
text:
In an indication that the party will not tolerate any hindrance to its social engineering for the 2017 Uttar Pradesh polls, the Bahujan Samaj Party has expelled a former MP and his brother, an MLC, for anti-party activities and obstructing the growth of Brahmins within the party fold.

The expelled leaders, former Phulpur MP Kapil Muni Kanwariya and his brother Surajbhan, also belong to the Brahmin community.

Senior BSP leader R.K. Chaudhary said the two leaders were expelled for indulging in anti-party activities despite at least three warnings. “After the Lok Sabha elections, we received complaints against them on many occasions. They were hindering the growth of the Brahmin Samaj [within the party],” Mr. Chaudhary said.

The Kanwariya brothers were reportedly obstructing the growth of Brahmins within the party
title: BSP expels former MP
